description: From Latin procax (“bold, impudent”), from proco (“ask, demand”), from procus (“suitor”).

adjectives.description: procacious (comparative more procacious, superlative most procacious)

examples: Another piece of Vain-glory to be Denied, is in The Reputation of strength and valour. The witless part of men, especially in their procacious humours, do use to be carried away with this  […]
